RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the flatbed trailer: flatbed trailer towed by the 2008 Chevrolet truck
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the bed of the 2008 Chevrolet truck: 2008 Chevrolet truck driven by Federico Saldana
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the cab of the 2008 Chevrolet truck: cab of the 2008 Chevrolet truck driven by Federico Saldana
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the 2008 Chevrolet truck driven by Feder: 2008 Chevrolet truck driven by Federico Saldana and flatbed trailer towed by the 2008 Chevrolet truck

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Federico Saldana: Defendant in the case, driver of the 2008 Chevrolet truck, gave consent to Williamson County Sheriff's Office to search the vehicle and trailer, identified himself during the traffic stop, served 9 years in federal prison
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Government: Party responding to Federico Saldana's motion, arguing that consent to search was voluntary
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Court in the above-styled cause: Court presiding over Federico Saldana's case, evaluating the voluntariness of consent to search, denied Federico Saldana's Motion to Suppress #24
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.2008 Chevrolet truck driven by Federico: Vehicle involved in a traffic stop due to unsafe lane changes and near-collisions, traveling at approximately 75 miles per hour, driven by Federico Saldana who was not used to driving this sort of truck and trailer combination, searched by Williamson County Sheriff's Office
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.flatbed trailer towed by the 2008 Chevro: Trailer searched by Williamson County Sheriff's Office after obtaining consent from Federico Saldana, transporting a scissor lift with new paint job and corrugated metal plates under the tires
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Gary Haston: Veteran narcotics investigator with Williamson County Sheriff's Office, testified about atypical features of the 2008 Chevrolet truck and flatbed trailer, including oversized tires and after-market rims often used to hide loads of narcotics
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Heather Vargas: Narcotics detective with Williamson County Sheriff's Office, relative newcomer to the narcotics division
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Daniel Martin Huerta: Registered owner of the flatbed trailer, first name mentioned by Federico Saldana as the owner, with license plate issued in Laredo on November 20, 2014, possible owner of the 2008 Chevrolet truck driven by Federico Saldana and the flatbed trailer towed by the 2008 Chevrolet truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Daniel A. Huerta: Registered owner of the 2008 Chevrolet truck, with license plate registered in San Antonio on July 31, 2014
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Gary Haston and Heather Vargas: Williamson County Sheriff's Office detectives involved in the case, with Gary Haston being a veteran narcotics investigator and Heather Vargas a relative newcomer to the narcotics division
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Josiah Bennett's patrol car: Patrol car used to transport K-9 dog used for searching, driven by Josiah Bennett during the search operation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Deputy Jason Cox's patrol video: Video recording of the traffic stop, with audio that is not entirely clear, captured the interaction between Federico Saldana and Williamson County Sheriff's Office during the traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.cab of the 2008 Chevrolet truck driven b: Area where vehicle registration documents were found, searched by K-9 dog through front and rear doors on driver side, contained identifying information for Daniel A. Huerta
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.smuggled persons: previously smuggled individuals, mentioned in Federico Saldana's criminal history
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.smuggled substances: illicit substances being searched for in the 2008 Chevrolet truck driven by Federico Saldana and the flatbed trailer towed by the 2008 Chevrolet truck, denied by Federico Saldana to be in his possession
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.cocaine: Specific type of drug mentioned in Federico Saldana's motion to suppress, argued as having no reasonable suspicion for stop and search, secreted substance discovered by officers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.methamphetamine: Specific type of drug asked about during interrogation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Williamson County Sheriff's Office video: Video recording made by Williamson County Sheriff's Office during the search, used to compare with Josiah Bennett's testimony
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.K-9 dog used for searching: Dog used by Josiah Bennett to search the 2008 Chevrolet truck and flatbed trailer
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.twenty four bundles of a compressed whit: Bundles that field-tested positive for cocaine, found after dismantling four batteries
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.specific type of smuggled substance: twenty four bundles of a compressed white powder that field-tested positive for cocaine, subject of Federico Saldana's motion to suppress
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.scissor lift: Scissor lift with new paint job and corrugated metal plates under the tires, transported on the flatbed trailer towed by the 2008 Chevrolet truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.smuggled persons and smuggled substances: Individuals and drugs smuggled by Federico Saldana in previous incidents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Federico Saldana's motion to suppress: Motion denied by the Court in the above-styled cause, filed as #24
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Sam Sparks: United States District Court Judge who signed the document on February 27, 2015
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court JUDGE: Judge presiding over Federico Saldana's case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.batteries used to conceal cocaine: Batteries dismantled by Deputy Jason Cox and Detective Gary Haston to retrieve twenty four bundles of a compressed white powder
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.2008 Chevrolet truck driven by Federico: Vehicle and trailer combination involved in a traffic stop due to unsafe lane changes and near-collisions, searched by Williamson County Sheriff's Office
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Federico Saldana's driver's license: License of Federico Saldana, examined by Williamson County Sheriff's Office officer during the traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.vehicle registration of the 2008 Chevrol: Registration documents of the vehicle driven by Federico Saldana, checked by Williamson County Sheriff's Office officer during the traffic stop, found in the cab of the 2008 Chevrolet truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Williamson County Sheriff's Office offic: Officer involved in a traffic stop, conducting computer checks and questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.detention during traffic stop: Detention that did not exceed its original scope, supported by facts justifying the traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.computer checks run by Williamson County: Checks conducted to gather relevant information for warning paperwork
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.questioning conducted by Gary Haston: Questioning that occurred while Jason Cox was gathering information for warning paperwork
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Williamson County Sheriff's Office: Law enforcement agency conducting the search and requesting consent from Federico Saldana
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.traffic violation: Reason for initial detention of Federico Saldana
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.suspicions of drug trafficking: Reason for continued investigation and search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.traffic stop on Interstate 35: Traffic stop initiated by Williamson County Sheriff's Office due to unsafe lane changes and near-collisions, resulted in the detention of Federico Saldana
